# vImageCVImageFormat_GetChannelNames(_:)

**Function**

Returns the names of the channels of a Core Video image format.

## Declaration

```swift
func vImageCVImageFormat_GetChannelNames(_ format: vImageConstCVImageFormat) -> UnsafePointer<vImageBufferTypeCode>!
```

## Parameters

- **format**: The Core Video image format to query.

## Return Value

A pointer to an array that contains the [doc://com.apple.accelerate/documentation/Accelerate/vImageBufferTypeCode] elements that correspond to the names of the channels in the image.

## Discussion

The functions that create Core Video image formats, such as [doc://com.apple.accelerate/documentation/Accelerate/vImageCVImageFormat_CreateWithCVPixelBuffer(_:)], return a [doc://com.apple.accelerate/documentation/Accelerate/vImageCVImageFormat]. The following code shows how you create a [doc://com.apple.accelerate/documentation/Accelerate/vImageConstCVImageFormat] representation of a [doc://com.apple.accelerate/documentation/Accelerate/vImageCVImageFormat] instance to pass to [doc://com.apple.accelerate/documentation/Accelerate/vImageCVImageFormat_GetChannelNames(_:)]:

```swift
let channelNames = withUnsafeBytes(of: cvImageFormat) { bytes in
    let format = bytes.assumingMemoryBound(
        to: vImageConstCVImageFormat.self).first!
    
    return vImageCVImageFormat_GetChannelNames(format)
}
```

## Related Documentation

- **channels**: The channels of the Core Video image format.

## Querying and setting channel information

- **vImageCVImageFormat_GetChannelCount(_:)**: Returns the number of channels, including alpha, for the Core Video image format.
- **vImageCVImageFormat_GetChannelDescription(_:_:)**: Returns the channel description for a particular channel type.
- **vImageCVImageFormat_CopyChannelDescription(_:_:_:)**: Copies the channel description for a particular channel type to an image format.
- **vImageChannelDescription**: A description of the range and clamp limits for a pixel format.
